question_text: Rule 021212 requires written notice of intent to remain in service to be given how long before expiration? (Level 1-5 Q1)

question_text: According to Rule 030101, officers must pass which examination after induction? (Level Confirmation Q60)
A Director discovers an officer failed confirmation exams three times but remains in service. What action should be taken? (Scenario 1)
explanation: Rule 030104 requires resignation after three consecutive failures.

question_text: A Director reviews a case where an officer delayed taking confirmation exams beyond three years. What is the proper decision? (Scenario 2)
explanation: Rule 030105 requires resignation if exams are not taken within the period.

question_text: A top manager is deciding whether to defer an officer’s increment for misconduct. What period is permitted? (Scenario 3)
A Director restores a previously deferred increment. When does it take effect? (Scenario 4)
explanation: Deferred increment takes effect after the specified deferment period.

question_text: A Permanent Secretary must notify an officer about restored increment. Who has this responsibility? (Scenario 5)
explanation: Rule 040208 assigns notification duty to the Permanent Secretary/Head.

question_text: A Director is unsure whether textbooks are allowed in a General Paper exam. What is correct? (Scenario 6)
explanation: Rule 030107 prohibits textbooks in General Paper.

question_text: An officer seeks severance allowance after completing service. What percentage applies? (Scenario 7)
A Director reviews emolument start date for a new officer. When should payment begin? (Scenario 8)
explanation: Rule 040102 states payment starts from assumption of duty.

question_text: As Head of Service, you discover a ministry is ignoring the rule on annual confirmation exams. What directive should you issue? (Executive Scenario 1)
option_b: Enforce immediate compliance with annual examination schedule

question_text: A top executive is reviewing systemic delays in increment decisions. What principle should guide disciplinary increment actions? (Executive Scenario 2)
option_d: Gravity of misconduct and prior service record
explanation: Rule 040204 requires considering gravity and previous service.

question_text: A ministry attempts to restore a withheld increment retroactively. What is the correct executive response? (Executive Scenario 3)
option_b: Reject due to prohibition of retrospective restoration

question_text: A Director-General proposes unlimited deferment of increments. What should top management state? (Executive Scenario 4)
An executive audit reveals emoluments were paid before assumption of duty. What corrective action aligns with PSR? (Executive Scenario 5)
option_d: Recover payments and enforce assumption-date rule
explanation: Rule 040102 requires payment from assumption of duty.

question_text: Top management evaluates officers seeking advancement beyond GL10. What institutional requirement applies? (Executive Scenario 6)
option_c: Attendance and success at approved institutions like ASCON/PSIN/CMD

question_text: A senior panel debates eligibility for confirmation exams without six months service. What is the lawful decision? (Executive Scenario 7)
option_a: Deny eligibility until six months service

question_text: A national review questions who determines examiner fees. What is the correct authority? (Executive Scenario 56)
option_c: Office of the Head of Civil Service of the Federation

question_text: As Head of Service, you discover a ministry is ignoring the rule on annual confirmation exams. What directive should you issue? (Executive Scenario 57)
option_b: Enforce immediate compliance with annual examination schedule

question_text: A top executive is reviewing systemic delays in increment decisions. What principle should guide disciplinary increment actions? (Executive Scenario 58)
option_a: Gravity of misconduct and prior service record
explanation: Rule 040204 requires considering gravity and previous service.

question_text: A ministry attempts to restore a withheld increment retroactively. What is the correct executive response? (Executive Scenario 59)
option_c: Reject due to prohibition of retrospective restoration

question_text: A Director-General proposes unlimited deferment of increments. What should top management state? (Executive Scenario 60)
